summary: This is an email chain from January 27, 2020, discussing the inclusion of a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew in a USANet carousel. The correspondence involves public affairs staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Berman Geoffrey
persons.context: Recipient of the forwarded email chain; U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the New York Times article being discussed for inclusion in the USANet carousel.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Co-subject of the New York Times article being discussed, in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Linked together as the subjects of a New York Times article, indicating a public association relevant to the Epstein case.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein and Prince Andrew
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew, which is suggested for inclusion in a USANet carousel by the U.S. Attorney's Office public affairs team.

keyFacts: On January 27, 2020, public affairs staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussed promoting a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and Prince Andrew.
The article's publication was considered 'pretty big news' and was suggested for a 'USANet carousel', a public-facing communications platform.
The email chain shows the office's public affairs team actively monitoring and considering media coverage related to the Epstein case.
